ENERGY QUANTITATION 

Electrons in atoms exist in discrete or quantized energy states.

Planck's theory of radiation suggests that energy is emitted from heated bodies in discrete or separate packets known as energy quanta. The energy of one quantum of radiation is given by 

E = hf 

The Franck-Hertz experiment gave the most direct proof of the existence of energy levels in atoms. 

Line spectrum is a spectrum that consists of a number of well-defined lines each having a particular frequency or wavelength. They arise when electrons in excited atoms jump from one level to a lower level. 

In the Photoelectric effect, electrons are emitted from the surface of metals when an electromagnetic wave e.g. light. falls on the metal surface. The photoelectric effect is the process whereby an electron is emitted by a metal when light shines on it, on the condition that the energy of the photons (light energy packets) are greater than or equal to the work function of the metal.

The maximum Kinetic energy of the photoelectrons is independent of the intensity of the incident light. It depends on the frequency or wavelength of the incident light. 

The threshold frequency, f0 is the lowest frequency that can cause photoemission from u metallic surface. 

Work function (W = hf0) is the minimum energy required to liberate an electron from a metallic surface. Einstein's photoelectric equation states that the maximum energy (E) of the emitted electrons is given by 

E = hf – W or

E = eV = hf - hfo 

X-rays are produced when thermally generated electrons from a hot filament are accelerated through a high p.d. and focused onto a tungsten target of high melting point where the electrons are suddenly stopped. The energy of the impinging energetic electrons is converted mostly into heat. A small percentage of the energy is converted into X-rays. The heat generated is removed by cooling fins. 

X-rays are electromagnetic waves of short wavelength (~10-8cm). They have high penetrating power, They are used in the medical field and in industry. 

 

Example

If light with photon energy 2eV is incident of surface of a metal with work function 3eV, then

A. no electron will be emitted

B. the few electrons emitted will have maximum kinetic energy of 1eV

C. the few electrons emitted will have a maximum kinetic energy of 3eV

D. many electrons will be emitted with maximum kinetic energy of 5eV

A (2006/2007, no14)

no electron will be emitted

Example

A light of energy 5 eV falls on a metal and the electrons with a maximum kinetic energy of 2 eV are ejected. The work function of the metal is

A. 0.4eV, B. 2.5 eV, C. 3.0 eV, D. 7.0 eV

C (2011/2012, no15)

Work function (W) is the minimum quantity of energy which is required to remove an electron to infinity from the surface of a given solid, usually a metal.

E = W + k.e

Given that Work function (W) = 5eV, kinetic energy = 2Ev

E = 5Ev – 2eV

E = 3eV
